div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 577 Pianul de Sus, 27 km. SSW of Alba (812, 934) Iulia, Rumania, 1852 Burial: late 2nd cent. B.C. (Mitrea) Contents: 50 AR Thasos: 1 spread-flan tetradr. Apollonia, Elyria 26 dr. Dyrrhachium 23 dr. Disposition: Vienna Seidl, AfÖG 9 (1853), pp. 164-5 Noe's 812 and 934 are the same lid. No. 934 is listed as Sebes with a cross-reference to Mühlenbacher Stühl
